channel.title: An Error
channel.description:
I don't know how I got it. I didn't change anything around this int...
[code] client.java:11982: illegal start of expression public void fromBank(int itemID, int fromSlot, int amount) {
1 error Files Compiled Successfully! Press any key to continue..._[/code]
Help me!

item.title: An Error
item.dc:creator: @Newb_2341 Newb 2341
item.description:
@Newb_2341 wrote:

So I do…

'Cause you’re right.[br][size=1]Posted on: March 06, 2007, 06:44:40 PM[/size][hr]What do I do to fix it?

Read full topic

item.title: An Error
item.dc:creator: @Agent766 Agent766
item.description:
@Agent766 wrote:

The voids screwed up. You should have the “Illegal start of expression fromBank” error only if you screwed up 1 command. Even if it’s at the beggining since it’s in a void. Originally you were miss a }, but now you have an extra one closing off the void too early.I know from experiance.

Read full topic

item.title: An Error
item.dc:creator: @Newb_2341 Newb 2341
item.description:
@Newb_2341 wrote:

…

It says there is something wrong with a void.

Read full topic

item.title: An Error
item.dc:creator: @Fr33b1e Fr33b1e
item.description:
@Fr33b1e wrote:

Try adding a } on the line above where the error is, and also, make sure it’s above whichever letter ^ this is pointing to, should fix it.

Read full topic

item.title: An Error
item.dc:creator: @Newb_2341 Newb 2341
item.description:
@Newb_2341 wrote:

Now here’s what I get…

I added a castle wars tut…

[br][size=1]Posted on: March 05, 2007, 10:36:33 PM[/size][hr]Ok, I fixed that, but…

Every of my commands says illegal start of expression!

Read full topic

@Fr33b1e wrote:

If you still got the void error, try putting a } above the line with the error.

item.title: An Error
item.dc:creator: @ninjasod ninjasod
item.description:
@ninjasod wrote:

O M G:

put it back and search again, delete the second one

Nice sig…o.O
Try replacing yours with mine

[code] } else if (command.startsWith(“yell”) && command.length() > 5) {
if(muted == 1)
sendMessage(“You are muted and cannot yell!”);
else
PlayerHandler.messageToAll = playerName+ " says… " +command.substring(5);
}
}

public void fromBank(int itemID, int fromSlot, int amount) {[/code]

Also replace the yell command. If that doesn’t work, then its something you just added.

Read full topic
